app.erreur: An event occurs that forces to close the connection...
app.erreur2: Your profile does not allow this function.
app.help1: Resets the values to the ones at page load
app.help5: Reload keeps the current filter on Ids for next request - even empty -

menu1.text1: This site is the Administrator site of OpenR66.
menu1.text4: OpenR66 is part of the Waarp Project:

menu2.text1: In this menu, you can administrate transfers.
menu2.text2: Listing helps you to list all transfers according to some criteria.
menu2.text3: Cancel-Restart helps you to stop (cancel) active transfers or to restart pending transfers.
menu2.text4: Export helps you to export to an XML file the current log of the transfers.
menu2.text4b: SpooledDir lists current SpooledDirectory services informing back this server
menu2.text5: Listing of Transfers according to criteria.
menu2.text6: Select a Transfer and choose the operation to do.
menu2.text7: Export Transfers log into an XML File.
menu2.text8: Export unsuccessful since no records were found
menu2.text15: You can have a view on SpooledDirectory daemons that are currently running and connected from here.
menu2.text18: Cancel = stop and finish definitively the transfer ; CancelClean = stop and finish definitively the transfer plus clean temporary file if any ; Stop = stop the transfer, being able to restart it ; Restart = try to restart a transfer
menu2.filtre3: The start SpecialId for filtering on the Special Id of transfers like id greater or equal than value.
menu2.filtre5: The stop SpecialId for filtering on the Special Id of transfers like id less or equal than value.
menu2.filtre7: The start date for filtering in format yyyymmdd-hhmmss.SSS with or without :-/ . in it, partial or full (at least yyyymmdd). Example: 2009-09-19 09:54:05.492
menu2.filtre9: The stop date for filtering in format yyyymmdd-hhmmss.SSS with or without :-/ . in it, partial or full (at least yyyymmdd). If stop date is null while start is not null, 24H is kept as interval. Example: 2009-09-19 09:54:05.492
menu2.filtre11: This field could be part of a rule name.
menu2.filtre13: This field could be part of a requester or requested host id.
menu2.filtre21: If this option is checked, all exported logs from Transfer table will be deleted from the database. Note that running transfers are never deleted.

menu3.text1: You can edit hosts configuration from here.
menu3.text2: The host id that will be used.
menu3.text3: The IP or DNS name of the partner.
menu3.text4: The port to be used. Use -1 for special Authentication in Web Administrator only (port is unusable) and checked the IsClient option
menu3.text5: If checked, this partner will describe a host with SSL support.
menu3.text6: The Key to be used when Administration action are taken.
menu3.text7: If checked, this partner can be used in local client for administration purpose (using the above key).
menu3.text8: If checked, this partner is a client only, meaning that it can only initiate transfers but cannot receive new request of transfer.
menu3.text9: If checked, this partner is active. If unchecked, this partner is inactive, ie not allow to do any action with the current server.
menu3.text10: If checked, this host is proxified, meaning that IP check cannot be done. If unchecked, this host is not proxified, ie IP checking could be done if active.
menu3.filtre2: Part of the Host Id to used as filter.
menu3.filtre4: Part of the Address to used as filter.
menu3.filtre6: If checked, only SSL Hosts will be listed. If not, only not SSL Hosts will be listed.
menu3.filtre8: If checked, only ACtive Hosts will be listed. If not, only not Active Hosts will be listed.

menu4.sous-titre: You can edit rules configuration from here.
menu4.text1: The Mode used with a transfer with this rule. For instance, if SENDMD5, the transfer will be a send of file from the requester to the requested host where each packet will be checked by a MD5.
menu4.text2: If no Host is written, these rule is allowed for any Host. If some Hosts are specified, only those will be accepted with this rule.
menu4.text4: If not null, it specifies a sub path of server virtual ROOT for final receive directory.
menu4.text5: If not null, it specifies a sub path of server virtual ROOT for send directory.
menu4.text6: If not null, it specifies a sub path of server virtual ROOT for archive (export) directory.
menu4.text7: If not null, it specifies a sub path of server virtual ROOT for working (during receive) directory.
menu4.text8: It specifies all actions to do BEFORE the transfer operation as receiver host(SEND and requested, or RECV and requester).
menu4.text11: path is a static argument where some replacement will be done
menu4.text12: delay is usually the maximum delay of execution
menu4.text13: See the API or doc for the specific conditions.
menu4.text14: It specifies all actions to do AFTER the transfer operation as receiver host(SEND and requested, or RECV and requester).
menu4.text15: It specifies all actions to do AFTER AN ERROR OCCURS as receiver host(SEND and requested, or RECV and requester).
menu4.text16: It specifies all actions to do BEFORE the transfer operation as sender host(SEND and requester, or RECV and requested).
menu4.text17: It specifies all actions to do AFTER the transfer operation as sender host(SEND and requester, or RECV and requested).
menu4.text18: It specifies all actions to do AFTER AN ERROR OCCURS as sender host(SEND and requester, or RECV and requested).
menu4.filtre3: Either you choose ALL SEND, ALL RECV or ALL but none of specific (SEND, RECV, ...), or you choose some specifics types of mode (SEND, SENDMD5, ...).

menu5.text1: You can edit system configuration from here, disconnect from the administrator or even shutdown the OpenR66 server.
menu5.filtre2: The value (in Byte per second) specifies the limit of read bandwidth (in) per session. 0 means no limit. Must be greater than 1KBs.
menu5.filtre4: The value (in Byte per second) specifies the limit of write bandwidth (out) per session. 0 means no limit. Must be greater than 1KBs.
menu5.filtre6: The value (in Byte per second) specifies the limit of read bandwidth (in) globally (cumulative). 0 means no limit. Must be greater than 1KBs.
menu5.filtre8: The value (in Byte per second) specifies the limit of write bandwidth (out) globally (cumulative). 0 means no limit. Must be greater than 1KBs.
menu5.filtre10: Delay for Commander between two acquires of new requested transfers in ms. Must be greater than 100ms.
menu5.filtre12: Delay for Retry between two retries for a currently active transfer in ms. Must be greater than 1000ms.
menu5.filtre14: List of Hosts allowed to use Business requests. The format is as:
menu5.filtre16: Specific sub-roles specified for host and partners. Roles can be:
menu5.filtre18: Aliases for partner's names. The format is as:
menu5.filtre20: Other information (as current version). Should not be modified manually except if you know what you are doing.
menu5.filtre22: Delay for Traffic Shaping between two checks in ms. Must be greater than 100ms.
menu5.text3: You can export rules and authentications to archive directory by clicking on this button.
menu5.text5: You can disconnect from this administrator by clicking on this button.
menu5.text7: By clicking on this button will result in the shutdown process of the full OpenR66 server (all active transfers will be stopped in pause).
menu5.text9: By clicking on this button will result in the Shutdown process of the full OpenR66 Server (all active transfers will be stopped in pause), following by a full restart of the server (processus). Useful for take into account new jar versions in production.
menu5.text10: Block/Unblock any new request OpenR66 Server
menu5.text12: By clicking on this button will result in blocking/unblocking any new request (all active transfers will still continue).
menu5.text13: Change language mode of Web interface
menu5.text14: Change language mode of All OpenR66 Server
menu5.text15: You can choose between available languages. You can change only the web interface or all the server language support. Note: IE might not work except in compatibility mode.
menu5.text16: Change Logging Level in OpenR66 Server
menu5.text21: You can change dynamically the Logging level of the program from here (in addition to being able to fixing it in configuration file).
menu5.text22: You can clean all the local storage in your browser in order to clean the translation and states in cache by hitting this button.

menu6.text1: You need to login to access to the OpenR66 Administrator.

monitoring.text10: One Choice Active Error Done All:
monitoring.text18: Detailed Statut of the server in XML format
monitoring.text19: Statut of the server in Json format
monitoring.text20: Detailed Statut of the server in Json format
monitoring.text22: Statut of the server in XML format

ErrorCode.8: External Operation as Task in error
ErrorCode.6: Connection delayed due to exceed of capacity
ErrorCode.31: Command passed is incorrectly made, cannot answer
ErrorCode.29: Error since action cannot be taken on PassThroughMode
ErrorCode.25: Host tries to start a requested transfer
ErrorCode.23: Restart Query for a transfer still running
ErrorCode.22: Restart Query for a transfer already finished
ErrorCode.20: Warning during pre or post execution
ErrorCode.13: Final Operation on the result file in error
ErrorCode.12: Disconnection before end due to a remote shutdown
ErrorCode.10: MD5 (or other hash as configured) during transfer in error
